data.title: Delaware State Parks
data.meta_description: Come to White Clay Creek to escape the encroaching development of New Castle County. The park's lush greenery and sparkling streams offer a refreshing change of pace and countless opportunities for outdoor fun and relaxation.
data.text:
Panning for Creek Gems

Saturday, August 10, 2024 at 10:30 AM

Pan the creek for garnets, magnetite, and other shiny treasures! We will provide materials for participants. Water shoes and towel recommended. Online program registration ends 24 hours prior to program. $6 per person

Register Online

Add to Calendar 8/10/2024 10:30:00 AM 8/10/2024 11:30:00 AM America/New_York Panning for Creek Gems Pan the creek for garnets, magnetite, and other shiny treasures! We will provide materials for participants. Water shoes and towel recommended. Online program registration ends 24 hours prior to program. $6 per person White Clay Creek

Nature Backpacks

Saturday, August 10, 2024 at 11:00 AM

Stop by the Chambers House Nature Center and check out our White Clay Creek Water, Geology or Birding Backpack. Each backpack contains detailed hiking directions and the supplies for activities to complete along the way. Specially designed for ages 4-10 years with adults. Must be 18 with a valid ID to check-out a backpack. Call 302-368-6560 to reserve your Backpack. We also have available Osmo color blind glasses to borrow. Free, with paid park admission! Available every day in the summer season while supplies last.

Full Moon Friday

Friday, August 16, 2024 at 8:00 PM

Join our park naturalist for an evening hike near the full moon. Online registration ends 24 hours prior to the program. After that, please call 302-368-6900 prior to 3 p.m. Meeting location provided upon registration. $6 per person

Register Online

Hiking Series

Saturday, August 24, 2024 at 9:00 AM

New to the park? Ready to find a new favorite trail? Then join our naturalist on this series to explore our trails. Dress for the weather, bring bottled water and come ready for adventure! Drop-Ins Welcome, registration suggested in case of weather cancellation. Call 302-368-6560 by noon on Friday to register. Free, with paid park admission!

Ethnobotany: People and Plants

Saturday, September 7, 2024 at 10:00 AM

Come along on a guided 1.5 mile hike through Judge Morris Estate as we learn about some of the many ways people utilize plants and discuss how our use of plants has shaped the modern landscape. Wear comfortable walking shoes and bring plenty of water for a gentle 2 hour walk through the woods. This program is provided by Master Naturalist Mary Osman. Pre-registration is required by calling 302-368-6900. Free, with paid park admission!

Add to Calendar 9/7/2024 10:00:00 AM 9/7/2024 11:00:00 AM America/New_York Ethnobotany: People and Plants Come along on a guided 1.5 mile hike through Judge Morris Estate as we learn about some of the many ways people utilize plants and discuss how our use of plants has shaped the modern landscape. Wear comfortable walking shoes and bring plenty of water for a gentle 2 hour walk through the woods. This program is provided by Master Naturalist Mary Osman. Pre-registration is required by calling 302-368-6900. Free, with paid park admission! White Clay Creek

Girl Scouts Love State Parks

Saturday, September 14, 2024 at 1:00 PM

Join us to learn about how to care for and protect nature while we are in the outdoors. We’ll do some Leave No Trace activities and learn about how we protect nature and animals at White Clay Creek State Park. Explore why this park is a vital resource to our area, and what you can do to help keep our forests and creeks healthy. Please call 302-368-6900 to register. Badges not provided, $6 per scout. Meets at the Chambers House Nature Center. Limited to 20 Daisy/Brownies and 20 Junior/Cadette/Seniors.

Add to Calendar 9/14/2024 1:00:00 PM 9/14/2024 3:00:00 PM America/New_York Girl Scouts Love State Parks Join us to learn about how to care for and protect nature while we are in the outdoors. We’ll do some Leave No Trace activities and learn about how we protect nature and animals at White Clay Creek State Park. Explore why this park is a vital resource to our area, and what you can do to help keep our forests and creeks healthy. Please call 302-368-6900 to register. Badges not provided, $6 per scout. Meets at the Chambers House Nature Center. Limited to 20 Daisy/Brownies and 20 Junior/Cadette/Seniors. White Clay Creek

Stroller Ramblers

Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 10:00 AM

Do you want to hike stroller friendly paths with a Naturalist? Come explore our parks, learn about and share the nature we encounter with your little ones, and meet other caregivers and parents. Free Program, pre-register and get meeting location by calling 302-368-6900 by the day before.

Come explore our parks, learn about and share the nature we encounter with your little ones, and meet other caregivers and parents. Free Program, pre-register and get meeting location by calling 302-368-6900 by the day before. White Clay Creek

Signs of Fall Hike

Saturday, September 21, 2024 at 10:00 AM

Join our naturalist on a hike to look for signs of fall near the Autumnal Equinox. Dress for the weather, bring water and come ready for adventure! Registration required; meeting location provided upon registration. Call 302-368-6900, FREE.

Saturday, October 12, 2024 at 10:00 AM

New to the park? Ready to find a new favorite trail? Then join the park naturalist on this series to explore trails and discover nature in White Clay Creek State Park. Dress for the weather, bring bottled water and come ready for adventure! Pre-registration required, call 302-368-6900 by Friday at 3 p.m. Free

40th Anniversary Hike

Wednesday, October 16, 2024 at 1:00 PM

Join us as we take a hike to the Pennsylvania state line to commemorate 40 years of preservation of the Bi-State Preserve

Add to Calendar 10/16/2024 1:00:00 PM 10/16/2024 3:00:00 PM America/New_York 40th Anniversary Hike Join us as we take a hike to the Pennsylvania state line to commemorate 40 years of preservation of the Bi-State Preserve White Clay Creek

40th Anniversary Celebration

Saturday, October 19, 2024 at 12:00 PM

Join us at the pavilion at Carpenter Recreation area to celebrate our 40th Anniversary. We'll have a day of hikes, history and fun. No registration required.

Add to Calendar 10/19/2024 12:00:00 PM 10/19/2024 4:00:00 PM America/New_York 40th Anniversary Celebration Join us at the pavilion at Carpenter Recreation area to celebrate our 40th Anniversary. We'll have a day of hikes, history and fun. No registration required. White Clay Creek

Orienteering

Saturday, October 26, 2024 at 10:00 AM

Join volunteer Mary Frank for an intro to orienteering. This is a fun sport that involves navigational skills. Call to register by October 24. 302-368-6900. Free program. Appropriate for ages 5 and up with an adult partner.

Veterans Day Apple Pie Social

Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 1:00 PM

Honor Veterans at the park’s annual Apple Pie Social. Veterans and guests are invited for pie and conversation in the lovely Judge Morris Estate. Local veterans will have displays of their military service or current veteran activities. Contact 302-368-6900 for more information. We will be serving coffee and pie, courtesy of Perkins Restaurant. Free to veterans and their guests.

Add to Calendar 11/10/2024 1:00:00 PM 11/10/2024 3:00:00 PM America/New_York Veterans Day Apple Pie Social Honor Veterans at the park’s annual Apple Pie Social. Contact 302-368-6900 for more information. We will be serving coffee and pie, courtesy of Perkins Restaurant. Free to veterans and their guests. White Clay Creek

History Hike

Friday, November 29, 2024 at 10:00 AM

Join local historian Jim Jones on a hike to learn about the families that used to live here at the park. We will go out to find the historic farms of free black farmers in the Carpenter area of the park. Be prepared for a 2-3 mile hike on uneven terrain. Pre-register by calling 302-368-6900, space is limited.
